sources.title: Letter Never Sent
sources.description:
The end of the 1950s. Four geologists are searching for diamonds in the Siberian taiga. After a long and exhausting work, the diamond tube is mapped. The heroes rejoice at their victory, dream of returning home soon, of meeting with their relatives. But a natural disaster occurs - the taiga is engulfed in fire for many miles around, cutting off the path to boats with food and equipment.

IMDb rating: 7.8

Year of production: 1959

Director: Mikhail Kalatozov
Writers: Viktor Rozov, Grigory Koltunov, Valery Osipov
Composer: Kryukov Nikolay
Operator: Urusevsky Sergey
Production Designer: Vinitsky David

Cast: Livanov Vasily, Smoktunovsky Innokenty, Urbansky Evgeny, Samoilova Tatyana, Kozhakina Galina

sources.title: Letter Never Sent (1960)
sources.description: Letter Never Sent is a 1960 Soviet adventure drama film directed by Mikhail Kalatozov and starring Tatiana Samoilova. It was entered into the 1960 Cannes Film Festival, but was withdrawn just before the screening on 17 May; according to the Soviet representatives, the film was "unfinished". The film was shot in black-and-white with a 4:3 aspect ratio and monaural sound. ItÂ  follows a geological expedition in the Siberian wilderness where four members, including a guide and three geologists, search for diamonds. As they face the challenges of nature, including a devastating forest fire, personal tensions arise, leading to tragedy and survival struggles among the group.

metadata.Plot: The film is based on the eponymous book by Valery Osipov. Four geologists are searching for diamonds in the wilderness of Siberia. After a long and tiresome journey they manage to find their luck and put the diamond mine on the map. The map must be delivered back to Moscow. But on the day of their departure a terrible forest fire wreaks havoc, and the geologists get trapped in the woods.
